attributes.action: Reconsider charging Private Hire Mini Cab Driver’s Congestion Charge
attributes.additional_details:
The mayor of London has decided to charge minicab (private hire drivers) congestion charge from April 2019, this is absolutely absurd considering minicabs are part of London’s transport infrastructure.

It would seem there are different rules in place for black cabs (hackney carriage) drivers as they are still exempt

This is totally unfair and I would like parliament to consider the case
attributes.background:
PHVs and the Congestion Charge
From 8 April 2019, private hire vehicles will no longer be exempt from paying the Congestion Charge when driving in central London

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the issue you raise is not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. This is the responsibility of the Mayor of London, who is accountable to the London Assembly.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here:

https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions
